formattedAddress: 201 Allen St Store 3, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 201 Allen St Store 3, New York, NY 10002-1429, USA

editorialSummary.text: Busy, mural-decorated locale whipping up hefty sandwiches, large burgers & loaded fries.

originalText.text:
Loved the ambience to begin with. Not a very big place, but cozy enough. The food is halal and offers quite a good amount of options in meat and salads.

We took the pulled meat burger and crispy chicken burger. loved both of them. the meat was very juicy and flavorful. the french fries was full of seasoning and very fresh

originalText.text: The foods are absolute delicious halal food. One of the best burger and fries I’ve ever tasted. The patties are really very juicy and the fries are one of a kind. The Cowgirl burger is a highly recommended. One of the best I’ve ever had.

text.text: The foods are absolute delicious halal food. One of the best burger and fries I’ve ever tasted. The patties are really very juicy and the fries are one of a kind. The Cowgirl burger is a highly recommended. One of the best I’ve ever had.

originalText.text: A vegetarian’s review: food here is exceptional. It’s hard to come by a restaurant that actually prioritizes flavor and a melange of ingredients that tickles the taste buds (positively).  Even though the restaurant is marketed in its name as being meat focused, I found the vegetarian options to be stellar.  It’s quality over quantity, folks. I had the dal’er bora (Bangladeshi lentil fritters) that just blew me away — the cilantro, Serrano, garlic sauce that it comes with is divine!! The pickled onions are just right — you know the chef is on point when they don’t disregard the chopping; the onions are chopped in long thin slices which marry this dish together in a “until death do us part” kind of way.  The masala risotto with chicken dish was reimagined for me when I told them I was vegetarian — they removed the chicken but didn’t remove the flavor or the value.  The masala risotto was served with mushroom and broccoli rabe, and then a sprinkle of Parmesan which tied it together in an official, “here I am” sort of way.  The beer and wine options were also great, and gave a solid assist to the food.  It’s the kind of place where you surrender and just let the staff / owner take over as trusted guardians of your palate. Stop everything you are doing and please, please go here.  You will not regret it!

originalText.text: Stopped by with my cousin and was blown away by the quality of the cuisine and atmosphere. Even though the food had every bit of authenticity in flavor, taste and texture, it also had a unique touch to it which would set it apart from anything your mom would have made for you. Now my mom is a great cook but this definitely would be a home away from home experience. I had the ceviche and the chicken korma, they were both excellent. The korma was quite filling and was served with bread, a bit different from what I expected, definitely would recommend both those dishes . The ceviche was on point and was of the best I have had, and I have been all over the world.

originalText.text: I was really excited to visit this place as it’s Halal but their food wasn’t good enough. I have never had these kind of experiences before. I felt like they put too much sauce on the sandwich, terrible taste. Empanadas were ok but not so tasty. I would never go back there.
